Trump Jr. had been told that he would be meeting a "Russian government attorney" and that the payoff might be "official documents and information that would incriminate Hillary and her dealings with Russia and would be very useful to your father."
Take the meeting Donald Trump Jr., Jared Kushner and Manafort had with Russian lawyer Natalia V. Veselnitskaya at Trump Tower on June 9, 2016.
But "collusion" also has been used to describe other activities.
